intro: Coelachne pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful grass or the slender leaved grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family, Poaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, pale green or brownish spikelets that are typically arranged in clusters along the stem. Native to various regions in Africa and Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Coelachne pulchella is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
